NWBFile.notes: Procedures:Ephys recording with acute probe(s), Project:None

Trials.name: start_time
Trials.description: 2 column array giving each trials start (i.e. beginning of quiescent period) and stop (i.e. end of iti) times of trials in universal seconds

Trials.name: stop_time
Trials.description: 2 column array giving each trials start (i.e. beginning of quiescent period) and stop (i.e. end of iti) times of trials in universal seconds

Trials.name: trials_choice
Trials.description: which choice was made in choiceworld: -1 (turn CCW), +1 (turn CW), or 0 (nogo)

Trials.name: trials_contrastLeft
Trials.description: contrast of left-side stimulus (0...1) nan if trial is on other side

Trials.name: trials_contrastRight
Trials.description: contrast of right-side stimulus (0...1) nan if trial is on other side

Trials.name: trials_feedbackType
Trials.description: Whether feedback is positive or negative in choiceworld (-1 for negative, +1 for positive)

Trials.name: trials_feedback_times
Trials.description: Time of feedback delivery (reward or not) in choiceworld - in absolute seconds, rather than relative to trial onset

Trials.name: trials_goCueTrigger_times
Trials.description: Time of go cues in choiceworld - in absolute seconds, rather than relative to trial onset NOTE: this is the time the trigger command is sent by Bpod

Trials.name: trials_goCue_times
Trials.description: Time of go cues in choiceworld - in absolute seconds, rather than relative to trial onset

Trials.name: trials_itiDuration
Trials.description: Intertrial interval duration for each trial

Trials.name: trials_probabilityLeft
Trials.description: Probability that the stimulus will be on the left hand side for the current block. The probability of right is 1 minus this

Trials.name: trials_response_times
Trials.description: Time of "response" in choiceworld- in absolute seconds, rather than relative to trial onset. This is when one of the three possible choices is registered in software, will not be the same as when the mouse's movement to generate that response begins.

Trials.name: trials_rewardVolume
Trials.description: volume of reward given each trial in µl

Trials.name: trials_stimOn_times
Trials.description: Times of stimuli in choiceworld - in absolute seconds, rather than relative to trial onset

Units.name: clusters_channels
Units.description: Channel which has the largest amplitude for this cluster. Note this counts all channels in the whole recording (starting from zero), rather than just the channels on this cluster's home probe - so if you want to find this cluster's brain location, it would be channels.brainLocation[clusters.peakChannel[i],:]

Units.name: clusters_depths
Units.description: [nc] Depth of mean cluster waveform on probe (µm). 0 means deepest site, positive means above this.

Units.name: clusters_metrics
Units.description: Quality control metrics at the cluster level. Fields may vary.

Units.name: clusters_uuids
Units.description: Unique identifier assigned to each cluster when ALF files created and during manual curation.

Units.name: clusters_waveforms
Units.description: Waveform from spike sorting templates (stored as a sparse array, only for a subset of channels closest to the peak channel)

Units.name: clusters_waveformsChannels
Units.description: Index of channels that are stored for each cluster waveform. Sorted by increasing distance from the maximum amplitude channel.

Units.name: clusters_clusters
Units.description: [nspi]. Cluster assignments for each spike (integers counting from 0).

Units.name: clusters_depths
Units.description: [nspi]. Depth along probe of each spike (µm; computed from waveform center of mass). 0 means deepest site, positive means above this

Units.name: clusters_samples
Units.description: [nspi]. Sample index of spikes in their own electrophysiology binary file.

Units.name: clusters_templates
Units.description: Detection template assignment for each spike (integers counting from 0). Can be used as direct indexing of the templates.* attributes.

Units.name: clusters_times
Units.description: [nspi]. Times of spikes (seconds, relative to experiment onset). Note this includes spikes from all probes, merged together

ElectrodeTable.name: channels_localCoordinates
ElectrodeTable.description: relative to probe coordinate system (µm): x (first) dimension is on the width of the shank while (y) is the depth where 0 is the deepest site, and positive above this.

ElectrodeTable.name: channels_rawInd
ElectrodeTable.description: [nch] Each channel's row in its home file (look up via probes.rawFileName), counting from zero. Note some rows don't have a channel, for example if they were sync pulses

SpikeEventSeries.name: spikes_clusters
SpikeEventSeries.description: [nspi]. Cluster assignments for each spike (integers counting from 0).

SpikeEventSeries.name: spikes_depths
SpikeEventSeries.description: [nspi]. Depth along probe of each spike (µm; computed from waveform center of mass). 0 means deepest site, positive means above this

SpikeEventSeries.name: spikes_samples
SpikeEventSeries.description: [nspi]. Sample index of spikes in their own electrophysiology binary file.

SpikeEventSeries.name: spikes_templates
SpikeEventSeries.description: Detection template assignment for each spike (integers counting from 0). Can be used as direct indexing of the templates.* attributes.
